intro: Bupleurum tenuissimum subsp. gracile, commonly known as slender valerian, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. Its slender stems and finely divided leaves contribute to its ornamental value in gardens. The subspecies gracile is distinguished by its more delicate and compact growth compared to other subspecies of Bupleurum tenuissimum.
